extraInputs.name: max_length
extraInputs.tooltip: discard sequences with more than the specified number of bases. Note that if 'trunc length' setting is specified, then 'max length' SHOULD NOT be lower than 'trunc lenght' (otherwise all reads are discared) [empty field = no action taken]

extraInputs.name: qmin
extraInputs.tooltip: the minimum quality score accepted for FASTQ files. The default is 0, which is usual for recent Sanger/Illumina 1.8+ files. Older formats may use scores between -5 and 2

extraInputs.name: maxee_rate
extraInputs.tooltip: discard sequences with more than the specified number of expected errors per base (empty field = no action taken)

extraInputs.name: truncqual
extraInputs.tooltip: tuncate sequences starting from the first base with the specified base quality score value or lower (empty field = no action taken)

extraInputs.name: truncee
extraInputs.tooltip: runcate sequences so that their total expected error is not higher than the specified value (empty field = no action taken)

extraInputs.name: cores
extraInputs.tooltip: number of cores to use

Inputs.name: maxee
Inputs.tooltip: maximum number of expected errors per sequence. Sequences with higher error rates will be discarded

Inputs.name: maxNs
Inputs.tooltip: discard sequences with more than the specified number of Ns

Inputs.name: min_length
Inputs.tooltip: minimum length of the filtered output sequence. Note that if 'trunc length' setting is specified, then 'min length' SHOULD BE lower than 'trunc lenght' (otherwise all reads are discared)

Inputs.name: trunc_length
Inputs.tooltip: truncate sequences to the specified length. Shorter sequences are discarded; thus if specified, check that 'min length' setting is lower than 'trunc length' ('min lenght' therefore has basically no effect) [empty field = no action taken]

Inputs.name: qmax
Inputs.tooltip: specify the maximum quality score accepted when reading FASTQ files. The default is 41, which is usual for recent Sanger/Illumina 1.8+ files. For PacBio data use 93

extraInputs.name: leading_qual_threshold
extraInputs.tooltip: quality score threshold to remove low quality bases from the beginning of the read. As long as a base has a value below this threshold the base is removed and the next base will be investigated (empty field = no action taken)

extraInputs.name: trailing_qual_threshold
extraInputs.tooltip: quality score threshold to remove low quality bases from the end of the read. As long as a base has a value below this threshold the base is removed and the next base will be investigated (empty field = no action taken)

extraInputs.name: cores
extraInputs.tooltip: number of cores to use

extraInputs.name: phred
extraInputs.tooltip: phred quality scored encoding. Use phred64 if working with data from older Illumina (Solexa) machines

Inputs.name: window_size
Inputs.tooltip: the number of bases to average base qualities. Starts scanning at the 5'-end of a sequence and trimms the read once the average required quality (required_qual) within the window size falls below the threshold

Inputs.name: required_quality
Inputs.tooltip: the average quality required for selected window size

Inputs.name: min_length
Inputs.tooltip: minimum length of the filtered output sequence

extraInputs.name: trim_polyG
extraInputs.tooltip: specify the minimum length for polyG tail trimming. Useful for Illumina NextSeq/NovaSeq data, where read tails contain multiple Gs, which means no signal in the Illumina two-color systems (empty field = disable_trim_poly_g)

extraInputs.name: trim_polyX
extraInputs.tooltip: specify the minimum length to trim polyX (i.e. multiple A, T or Cs) in the read tail (empty field = no action taken)

extraInputs.name: max_length
extraInputs.tooltip: reads longer than 'max length' will be discarded, default 0 means no limitation

extraInputs.name: trunc_length
extraInputs.tooltip: truncate sequences to specified length. Shorter sequences are discarded; thus check that 'min length' setting is lower than 'trunc length'

extraInputs.name: aver_qual
extraInputs.tooltip: if one read's average quality score <'aver_qual', then this read/pair is discarded. Default 0 means no requirement

extraInputs.name: low_complexity_filter
extraInputs.tooltip: enable low complexity filter and specify the threshold for low complexity filter. The complexity is defined as the percentage of base that is different from its next base (base[i] != base[i+1]). E.g. vaule 30 means then 30% complexity is required. Not specified = filter not applied

extraInputs.name: cores
extraInputs.tooltip: number of cores to use

Inputs.name: window_size
Inputs.tooltip: the window size for calculating mean quality

Inputs.name: required_qual
Inputs.tooltip: the mean quality requirement per sliding window (window_size)

Inputs.name: min_qual
Inputs.tooltip: the quality value that a base is qualified. Default 15 means phred quality >=Q15 is qualified

Inputs.name: min_qual_thresh
Inputs.tooltip: how many percents of bases are allowed to be unqualified (0-100)

Inputs.name: maxNs
Inputs.tooltip: discard sequences with more than the specified number of Ns

Inputs.name: min_length
Inputs.tooltip: minimum length of the filtered output sequence. Shorter sequences are discarded

extraInputs.name: truncQ
extraInputs.tooltip: truncate reads at the first instance of a quality score less than or equal to truncQ

extraInputs.name: truncLen
extraInputs.tooltip: truncate reads after truncLen bases (applies to R1 reads when working with paired-end data). Reads shorter than this are discarded. Explore quality profiles (with QualityCheck module) and see whether poor quality ends needs to be truncated

extraInputs.name: truncLen_R2
extraInputs.tooltip: applies only for paired-end data. Truncate R2 reads after truncLen bases. Reads shorter than this are discarded. Explore quality profiles (with QualityCheck module) and see whether poor quality ends needs to be truncated

extraInputs.name: maxLen
extraInputs.tooltip: remove reads with length greater than maxLen. maxLen is enforced on the raw reads. In dada2, the default = Inf, but here set as 9999

extraInputs.name: minQ
extraInputs.tooltip: after truncation, reads contain a quality score below minQ will be discarded

extraInputs.name: matchIDs
extraInputs.tooltip: applies only for paired-end data. If TRUE, then double-checking (with seqkit pair) that only paired reads that share ids are outputted

Inputs.name: read_R1
Inputs.tooltip: applies only for paired-end data. Identifyer string that is common for all R1 reads (e.g. when all R1 files have '.R1' string, then enter '\.R1'. Note that backslash is only needed to escape dot regex; e.g. when all R1 files have '_R1' string, then enter '_R1'.)'

Inputs.name: read_R2
Inputs.tooltip: applies only for paired-end data. Identifyer string that is common for all R2 reads (e.g. when all R2 files have '.R2' string, then enter '\.R2'. Note that backslash is only needed to escape dot regex; e.g. when all R2 files have '_R1' string, then enter '_R2'.)

Inputs.name: samp_ID
Inputs.tooltip: applies only for paired-end data. Identifyer string that separates the sample name from redundant charachters (e.g. file name = sample1.R1.fastq, then '\.' would be the 'identifier string' (sample name = sample1)); note that backslash is only needed to escape dot regex (e.g. when file name = sample1_R1.fastq then specify as '_')

Inputs.name: maxEE
Inputs.tooltip: discard sequences with more than the specified number of expected errors

Inputs.name: maxN
Inputs.tooltip: discard sequences with more than the specified number of N’s (ambiguous bases)

Inputs.name: minLen
Inputs.tooltip: remove reads with length less than minLen. minLen is enforced after all other trimming and truncation
